Chapter 7, Part 2: The Assembly of the Armor of Adornments
Furthermore, Anantamati!

I recall that in the past when I was cultivating the conduct of a bodhisattva, I donned such armor and rode in such a great vehicle, transcending all limits, able to extinguish darkness, able to remove fear, with great diligence, and then heard this armor adornment of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and the adornment of the great vehicle from the places of immeasurable hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of buddhas.
When contemplating this Dharma with joy and delight, one respectfully venerates the buddhas and world-honored ones, and does not think like this:
'I don the such-and-such armor, I have such-and-such armor, I attain such-and-such Dharma, I have such-and-such Dharma, I have such-and-such kind of Dharma.

At that time, I had no thought of self, was far removed from the view of a self, far removed from the conceit of self, with a mind free from high and low, and also without discrimination. In order to embrace all sentient beings, to protect and uphold the Dharma treasury of the Buddhas and Tathagatas, and to mature countless hundreds of thousands of koá¹­is of nayutas of sentient beings, I never had a single thought of weariness.

At that time, I did not abandon the armor and mounted the boundless vehicle. In life after life, I was able to defeat the armies of Mara. The retinue of Mara retreated and perished, and the messengers of Mara fled in terror. All the non-Buddhist paths - the Carakas, the LokÄyatas, the PÄÅ›upatas, and those associated with these non-Buddhist paths - I subdued them all and brought them peace. All heretical theories were completely destroyed, and all non-Buddhist paths were completely defeated. Sentient beings in wrong paths were caused to abide in this vehicle, with the yoke of many good deeds.

For the sake of sentient beings, they reveal the armor and the adornments of the armor. They also expound such kinds of teachings for sentient beings, bringing them peace and happiness in the Great Vehicle. Abiding in this vehicle, one obtains all the peaceful and happy provisions, namely, the peaceful and happy provisions of conditioned existence, the peaceful and happy provisions of the wheel-turning sage king, the peaceful and happy provisions of the king of the Heaven of the Thirty-three and the king of the Brahma Heaven, and the attainment of the peaceful and happy provisions of the unconditioned.

When expounding this teaching for sentient beings, they enable sentient beings to enter this teaching and give rise to the holy lineage. They raise the great Dharma banner, roar the lion's roar, and set out for supreme, perfect enlightenment.
Infinite Wisdom!
Bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas should don such great armor and then rationally contemplate and select it. What Dharma should they set out for?
They are able to know and see all dharmas without discrimination.
Why is it so?
The bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in the right path because they know the truth as it is;
They set out on the right path because they see the truth as it is.
Knowing the truth as it is means neither discriminating nor not discriminating, but knowing and seeing equally in discrimination and non-discrimination.
If one sees that there are dharmas to be sought and found, then it is not equal, and one does not abide in the right knowledge and vision.
Because there is no discrimination and no nondiscrimination, one is free from grasping in discrimination and nondiscrimination;
Because there is no grasping, one is free from discrimination and nondiscrimination.
In this path there is no compassion, no activity, no increase, and no acceptance or rejection.
Abiding in the level and correct path, one does not discriminate the past, present, or future, but is able to thoroughly understand all discriminations.
The latent tendencies, in all dharmas, attain abiding in equality and the meaning of non-erroneousness, and are then said to abide in this path.
Boundless Wisdom!
What is the path and the purification of the path?
It is said to be the noble eightfold path:
Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

Right view can cut off the view of a personal self and transcend the realm of all views. All views are completely purified everywhere, and one can understand all conceptual thoughts, whether superior conceptual thoughts or pervasive conceptual thoughts, then there are no conceptual thoughts, no superior conceptual thoughts, and no pervasive conceptual thoughts.

Not dwelling in wrong thoughts, cutting off wrong conceptual thoughts, one can see right livelihood and the conception of right livelihood, see the purity of livelihood, and abide in the pure livelihood.
Seeing the pure bodily actions, pure verbal actions, and pure mental actions in accordance with principle.
Abiding in right action, right view, and verbal actions, one can see and know all speech and the speaker, abiding in right speech, one can purify the counteragent.
Right effort sees the good inclusion of effort, abides in right effort, and with right view and mindfulness, is without thought, also without intention, and without grasping.
With pure mindfulness, abiding in right mindfulness and right view samÄdhi, in samÄdhi one has no basis, and is able to purify the view of samÄdhi and abide in right concentration.
Anantamati!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas see in this way, they attain the pure right view in all places and abide in the pure path.

This pure path is practiced by good men, respected by the wise, approved by the sages, praised by the TathÄgatas, and is not the place practiced by all mÄras, mÄra followers, mÄra messengers, mÄra gods, and great assemblies, nor is it the place practiced by all those who love the teachings of non-Buddhist paths, rely on contentious debates, engage in the thicket of views, and enter into various non-Buddhist paths such as that of PÅ«raá¹‡a KÄÅ›yapa, nor is it the place practiced by all those who love nirvÄá¹‡a.
Why is this?
Those who abide in the unconditioned have discrimination regarding nirvÄá¹‡a, and discrimination regarding nirvÄá¹‡a is discrimination regarding conditioned phenomena.
Why is this?
Within the realm of nirvÄá¹‡a, all agitation and discrimination are transcended. There are not even unconditioned phenomena, let alone conditioned phenomena.
This path is able to purify all discrimination, and there is not even the discrimination of unconditioned phenomena. How could there be the discrimination of all conditioned phenomena?
If one has discrimination regarding the noble path, then one is not said to abide in the noble path.
If one cuts off all agitation and discrimination, then this is called abiding in the noble path, abiding in the fearless path, abiding in the peaceful path, and abiding in the blissful path.

This path leads to a place where there is no old age, sickness, death, worry, or suffering. This path leads to a place where there is no intrinsic nature and transcends nature. This path leads to a place where all natures and non-natures are far removed. This path leads to a place where there are no appearances of characteristics, no appearances of form. This path is like space, pervading everywhere, leading to the unsurpassed great palace.
In this way, the one who goes forth will never turn back, and will attain various kinds of peaceful and blissful happiness.

That great palace cannot be shown, has no various appearances, has no conditioned, has no unconditioned. It has extinguished the conditioned and abandoned the unconditioned, and does not provide sentient beings with the bliss of the conditioned or the bliss of the unconditioned.
Infinite Wisdom!
Those who delight in the conditioned nirvana, they still do not seek the bliss of the conditioned, let alone those who are able to be in the great palace?

In the great palace there is no establishment, it is cool, serene and tranquil, therefore it is called nirvana. It extinguishes greed, hatred and delusion, severs the latent tendencies, tears apart the net of craving and views, dries up the flow of ignorance, uproots the many poisonous arrows, and exhausts unwholesome dharmas, therefore it is called nirvana.
It is far removed from all arrogance, sickness, suffering, and oppression, therefore it is called nirvana.
It is not the domain of mind, thought, cognition, or mental factors, therefore it is called nirvana.
It puts an end to all disputes, bonds, and even the notion of dharmas, therefore it is called nirvana.
It cuts off all intentions, the objects of intention, and also the characteristics of discrimination and the discriminated, therefore it is called nirvana.
Boundless Wisdom!
This is the essence of the great parinirvÄá¹‡a.
NirvÄá¹‡a is boundless and cannot be spoken of. If it has a destination, then it is not the Way. The Way also has no words and cannot be spoken of.
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas enter the great palace of nirvÄá¹‡a through this path, they also cause innumerable hundreds of thousands of sentient beings to abide in this path.
Infinite Wisdom!

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas set out on this path, they are neither weary nor sorrowful. According to their desires, according to their adornments, according to the places of adornment, according to the individual adornments, according to the sentient beings to be guided, they expound the Dharma and cause all sentient beings to attain joy.
Why is this?
This path is unequaled, able to purify and counteract, and its function is ultimate.

The buddhas, the world-honored ones, and the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas all set out on this path without contradicting each other. Until they reach that ground, until their wishes are fulfilled, they will never part from it.
What is that ground?
It is the ground of nirvÄá¹‡a, the ground of the great palace.
It is like space, which cannot be compared to anything, except that space can be compared to space.

Vast, great, and empty and tranquil, it is called empty space. The palace of nirvana is also like this, being vast, great, and empty and tranquil, without a master or anything belonging to a self. If all sentient beings were to enter it, not a single hair's breadth could be appropriated.
Vast, great, and empty and tranquil, vast and immeasurable, is called great nirvana, called the great palace.
Infinite Wisdom!
This supreme path of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas is not possessed by the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

Those who abide in this path accomplish all the provisions of merit and virtue, attain irreversibility, and greatly benefit all sentient beings. With supreme conduct as their great adornment, they set out on this path.
Such adornment is also not possessed by the Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas abide in this path, even if they become a wheel-turning king, they have nothing to be attached to. They have great authority, spiritual powers, and transformations, and are able to understand the mundane and supramundane worlds.

If one becomes Åšakra, the Great Brahma Heaven King, one should be free from indulgence and arrogance, enjoy seeing the buddhas, enjoy hearing the true Dharma, mature countless hundreds of thousands of devas, and head towards supreme, perfect enlightenment.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
The supreme path of the bodhisattvas has no higher in the world.
All sages and the two vehicles all head towards this path.
All bodhisattvas set out for great enlightenment.
In order to attain the adornments of the path, they reveal this path.ğŸ”½Those who have already headed towards this path or are currently heading towards it
all abide in this path with right view.
If all bodhisattvas abide in the view of equality
and practice in this path, they will head towards it with ease and joy.
This path is most supreme, this path is unsurpassed,
Able to truly guide and progress, there is nothing to grasp within it.
If abiding in this path, practicing within this path,
All the wise ones, their minds are unmoved.
It is said that on this path, there are few who are moved,
Because of this, there is no movement, always far from movement.
I say that on this path, there is no movement, no activity,
Also no increase or benefit, this path is therefore unsurpassed.
All the bodhisattvas, well abiding in this path,
This path has no love, also has no hatred.
This path is not the past, this path is not the future,
The limits are not discriminated, thus is it cultivated and practiced.
This path has no afflictions, this path has no discrimination,
Not contradicting the meaning, thus is it peacefully abiding.
Abiding in the supreme path, non-abiding is abiding,
Those who abide in this path can attain pure nature.
I speak of the eightfold path, practiced by the sages,
Those who abide in this path can easily attain enlightenment.
The bodhisattvas' reliance is to abide in this path like this,
They can attain the purity of the path, progressing one by one.
This supreme path is practiced by the virtuous ones,
The wisdom praised by the TathÄgata is unsurpassed.
Demons and their armies, those controlled by demons,
Non-Buddhist paths and other beings, it is not their domain.
Those who discriminate nirvÄá¹‡a do not abide in this supreme path,
Fools are harmed by discrimination and cannot enter nirvÄá¹‡a.
Those who transcend discrimination have no thoughts and no discrimination,
In this great path, one sets out by means of this.
The supreme path of the sages, fools all keep far away from,
If one practices this Dharma, this path is unsurpassed.
This most excellent path can reach the unsurpassed place,
Within it there is no decline or distress, no fear or calamity.
This unsurpassed path has no form or appearance,
It cannot be manifested by form or appearance.
This peaceful path is straightforward and fearless,
Setting out on this path, one ultimately reaches great nirvana.
This most pure path is like the great empty space,
Everywhere unobstructed, always heading towards nirvana.
If one reaches nirvana, one goes forth and never returns,
This great nirvana is the most supreme and blissful.
The great palace of nirvana is empty and tranquil, immeasurable,
Therefore it is called great nirvana, and also called the great palace.
In this great nirvana, the poisons and afflictions are extinguished,
If one reaches it, there is no retrogression and no rebirth.
Nirvana is great, empty and tranquil, like the great void,
Vast and empty, therefore there are no obstructions within it.
The great palace of nirvana is forever free from suffering, worry and distress,
The realm without boundaries is called nirvana.
Nirvana has no measure, measure cannot be obtained,
The nature of tranquil extinction and coolness is called nirvana.
Nirvana is without establishment, the path to be taken is also unsurpassed,
Immeasurable, without discrimination, discrimination cannot be obtained.
I open up this path for the bodhisattvas,
If one abides in this path, one is close to nirvana.
If one abides in this path, one will attain the supreme bliss of the world,
And be called the fearless one.
Abiding well in this path, one's mind is unstained,
And by this the path is purified, one is called the fearless one.
Seeing the level and correct path, one is able to follow and awaken to it all,
And in all the requisites, one is not attached to anything.
The bodhisattvas, the ones to be relied upon, the supreme and true path,
Benefit all beings, and courageously set out.
If one attains the unsurpassed path, the supreme path adorned,
And causes the world to rejoice, one sets out on this path.
This path is most excellent, able to purify the mind,
According to one's desires and aspirations, all should set out.
If one attains the position of a holy king, with a great army of wheel-turning [kings],
One is able to abandon the position of a great king, leave the household life, and practice the path.
If one attains the position of Åšakra, lord of the devas, or the position of MahÄbrahmÄ,
One should not be attached to them, for this is the path of goodness.
In the world, all the rules of training, one is able to understand clearly,
Dwelling in this path, one is then a speaker of truth.
Moreover, AparimitÄyus!
When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas set out on this path,
In order to embrace the eightfold noble path, they practice one teaching, namely, not creating any unwholesome dharmas.
Moreover, in order to embrace the eightfold noble path, they practice two teachings:
First, internally contemplating any wholesome dharmas in accordance with principle; second, externally inquiring about any wholesome dharmas in accordance with principle.
Moreover, in order to embrace the eightfold noble path, they practice two teachings:
First, to understand that all phenomena are as they are; second, to understand that there are no affairs, no abiding, and nothing to discriminate.
Moreover, in order to embrace the Eightfold Right Path, one practices two dharmas:
First, to accord with and understand within; second, to be without attachment externally.
Moreover, in order to embrace the Eightfold Right Path, one practices two dharmas:
First, to have self-confidence and no discrimination;
Second, if sentient beings do not yet have faith, to cause them to abide in this path.
Moreover, in order to embrace the Eightfold Right Path, one practices two dharmas:
First, to truly know and see the work that is done; second, to be without attachment to the work that is done.
Moreover, in order to embrace the Eightfold Right Path, one practices three dharmas:
First, to understand each of the aggregates of suffering; second, to diligently seek bliss in the aggregates that are without suffering; third, to cultivate detachment from all compounded dharmas.
Furthermore, in order to embrace the eightfold right path, one practices three dharmas:
First, proclaiming the supreme Dharma, speaking without contradiction, and having no disputes in one's mind regarding the meaning of the Dharma that is spoken;
Second, not being attached to any written words;
Third, embracing all dharmas.
Furthermore, in order to embrace the eightfold right path, one practices four dharmas:

First, skillful means in regard to the meaning; second, skillful means in accordance with the meaning, which is the proper skillful means; third, skillful means in observing in accordance with the Dharma; fourth, skillful means in not giving rise to any attachments.
Furthermore, in order to embrace the eightfold right path, one practices four dharmas:

First, being able to guard oneself with firm vows and act in accordance with one's words; second, being able to skillfully direct one's six sense faculties towards the path; third, being able to purify one's intentions; fourth, being able to abide in heedful practice.
Infinite Wisdom!

Because bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas use these Dharma practices to embrace the path, they can be called those who follow the path. Because they contemplate the emptiness of the nature of all dharmas, because of non-name, because of signlessness, because of wishlessness, because of non-arising, because of non-action, because of disgust, because of separation, because of cessation, because of transcendence, they attain the light of the Dharma.

When contemplating the end of birth, they do not give rise to the notion of birth in the absence of birth. At that time, they transcend birth and surpass what is not Dharma, attain the purity of the path, and obtain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

Because the path is pure, they surpass all notions, do not dwell in non-notions, extinguish the notion of the path, leave the notion of dharmas, and leave the net of ignorance. With the illumination of cultivation, they are able to attain all the dharmas that should be attained.
What kind of dharmas are attained through the illumination of cultivation?

It refers to attaining the cessation of conceptualization and sensation through the illumination of cultivation, attaining skillful means in all dharmas, and attaining the secret in accordance with the nature of dharmas.

When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice this path, they do not abide in places, are not covered by characteristics, know that all dharmas are the same as space, give rise to the same as space gives rise to, and have the same nature as space, without the slightest characteristic to obstruct them.
This path is pure, fearless of calamities, wears the great armor, is not bound by grasping, rides the great vehicle without confusion, and is free from obstacles like space.
Setting out on this path, it becomes a great light for all beings.
Anantamati!
This is the supreme path of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, not practiced by Å›rÄvakas and pratyekabuddhas.
At that time the World-Honored One spoke a verse, saying:
In order to encompass the eightfold right path, expound the practices of all dharmas.
If one abides in this path, this is great diligence.
Those who cultivate wholesome dharmas are able at all times,
Not creating unwholesome dharmas, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who cultivate, contemplating the principles within,
seeking and inquiring externally, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who contemplate, correctly understanding as it is,
abiding in principle and Dharma as it is, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who rely, inwardly following and understanding,
externally grasping at nothing, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who are fearless, self-confident and without discrimination,
causing others to abide in pure faith, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who contemplate, purifying all activities,
without grasping at karma, this practice is included in the path.
For bodhisattvas who are unfettered, always understanding the suffering aggregates,
seeking the aggregates without suffering, this practice is included in the path.
The bodhisattva who is skilled in wisdom cultivates the practice of separation from union,
Able to separate from union, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva who contemplates meaning, in accordance with meaning, is able to understand,
Expounding without contradiction or dispute, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva who is endowed with wisdom does not become attached to words and letters,
Subsuming and upholding all dharmas, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva who practices the Dharma is able to accord with the Dharma,
Also in accordance with meaning, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva who follows the path abides correctly in firm vows,
Practicing in accordance with what is said, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva's path is pure, well-purified in intention,
Abiding in the Dharma without negligence, this practice subsumes the path.
The bodhisattva, at all times, diligently cultivates these practices,
The body and mind attain peace and joy, and this practice embraces the path.
The bodhisattva who is rightly mindful abides in the pure path,
And understands that all dharmas are empty and without characteristics.
The bodhisattva who contemplates is able to purify his vows,
And does not abide in the absence of vows, being free from all characteristics.
The bodhisattva who observes in accordance with principle sees the equality of principles,
And does not give rise to the slightest doubt about any dharma.
The bodhisattva who has wondrous wisdom is able to contemplate all dharmas,
Because of disenchantment and quiescence, he clearly sees and advances.
The bodhisattva who contemplates dharmas sees the arising of dharmas in accordance with principle,
But does not see arising in arising, and does not see cessation in cessation.
When the bodhisattva who is diligent observes in this way,
He departs from non-dharma and transcends to the correct position.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, this path is pure,
Swiftly reaching great peace and security, accomplishing unsurpassed patience.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, in accordance with contemplating all dharmas,
Surpassing all conceptual thoughts, always abiding in the absence of conceptual thoughts.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, this path is able to purify,
Far removed from the conceptual thought of the path, also not abiding in the conceptual thought of dharmas.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, because this path is purified,
Emerging from the net of ignorance, attaining the great light of the Dharma.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, able to cultivate with illumination,
Teaching and instructing all sentient beings, by this they set out.
The cultivation of illumination by the bodhisattvas, in order to attain all dharmas,
The definitive and profound meaning, skillful great expedient means.
The cultivation of illumination by the bodhisattvas, expedient means is free from conceptual thoughts,
In accordance with the secret Dharma, one can understand the definitive meaning.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas, with the great light of the Dharma,
Can extinguish thoughts and feelings, and thus set out on the path.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas does not dwell in this path,
Because it does not dwell in this path, it sets out on the path.
The fearless bodhisattvas are able to understand all dharmas,
Just like the pure sky, with no marks covering it.
The bodhisattvas know that the nature of all dharmas is the same as empty space,
Because all dharmas are like empty space, they are pure and without defilement.
The bodhisattvas abide like this, not obstructed by marks,
Quickly for the sake of all beings, expounding and instructing them.
The marvelous wisdom of the bodhisattvas purifies all paths,
In the path there are no calamities or misfortunes, unobstructed, they set out.
Thus, on this pure path, one quickly proceeds to great enlightenment,
Able to realize the unconditioned, and set out in equality.
The great armor of the bodhisattvas, the Great Vehicle and the Great Way,
Like space, unobstructed, set out in purity.
Setting out on this vehicle and way, like setting out into the vast sky,
Far removed from all characteristics, set out in the absence of characteristics.
The Great Vehicle, the equal vehicle, vast like space,
On this pure path, set out on this vehicle.
All bodhisattvas revere this Dharma,
For the sake of all beings, set out with courage.
If one proceeds to great enlightenment, abiding in this excellent way,
It is not for those of the two vehicles and others to set out on this.
The correct mindfulness of the bodhisattvas can purify the path,
With this pure path, one sets out for the supreme.
Moreover, AparimitÄyus!

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas set out in this way, they are able to skillfully and correctly understand the immeasurable foundations of mindfulness, correct exertions, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, liberations, samÄdhis and samÄpattis, supernormal powers, calm and insight, immeasurable merits and excellent adornments. In order to subdue all worldly beings, they don the great armor. In order to transcend the three realms, they ride the great vehicle. In order to embrace devas, humans, and asuras, they abide in this path and set out for supreme, perfect enlightenment.
AparimitÄyus!

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas don the great armor, ride the great vehicle, and abide in this path, they do not illuminate beings with immeasurable loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity, nor do they love all beings as they love themselves.
Such armor, the great vehicle, and the great path cannot be borne by the great earth, and all beings are not worthy to approach it.

If one is compassionate, benefits beings, dons the great armor, rides the great vehicle, and abides in this path, such armor, the great vehicle, and the great path cannot be practiced by any worldly gods, humans, or asuras, and all foolish worldlings who are attached to the world and dwell in the world also cannot see it.

Moreover, because the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas have compassion for all beings, they don the great armor and are able to empower the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element with the armor, causing this earth element not to be overturned, all beings not to give rise to fear, and enabling the water element, the fire element, and the wind element to do what they should do according to their respective functions.

Moreover, all Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas, from the initial stage of generating the mind of enlightenment up to the present, have donned this great armor and mounted this great vehicle, and with the pure path have set out for the stage of one lifetime to buddhahood, approaching the bodhi tree and sitting in the place of enlightenment.
In this trichiliocosm, the place of enlightenment is composed of vajra, solid and firm, but if not empowered, it would sink, overturn, and be destroyed.
Although composed of solid vajra, it would not be able to bear this great armor, great vehicle, and great path.

Moreover, the past vows of all Bodhisattva-MahÄsattvas, out of compassion for sentient beings, are praised by the buddhas and great bodhisattvas of the ten directions. Even if the great vajra-encircling mountains, Mount Sumeru, all precious mountains, and other king-like mountains were to be empowered, they would still not be able to bear this great armor, great vehicle, and great path.

Moreover, by the power of the original vows of the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas and the original vows of the buddhas, for the sake of not afflicting, not harming, not injuring, not being hostile, not being antagonistic, not being arrogant, and not oppressing sentient beings, and for the sake of enabling sentient beings to attain peace and happiness, they don the great armor and ride the great vehicle, abiding in this path and setting out for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.
Infinite Wisdom!

When the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas don the armor, they don the armor of wisdom, hold the weapons of wisdom, and greatly dedicate their wisdom. They ride the vehicle of dedication, arouse the light of wisdom, and abide in the path of light. With the eyes of wisdom, they observe all dharmas and give rise to omniscience.

It is rare, World-Honored One!

The various wisdoms of bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas pervade all places and encompass all dharmas. They don the great armor, ride the great vehicle, and abide in this great path. Each and every one takes wisdom as the forerunner and sets out on it.
